22:04 shouldnt there only be a single non bonding electron on carbon because carbon has 4 valence electrons, 3 of which are shared with nitrogen so only 1 is left.. right?
20 lone pair electrons are 10 lone pairs (of electrons).
Why 20 lone pairs is same as 10 lone pairs?
@StarlightCharlene idiots like you on yahoo answer not mit lectures
@StarlightCharlene No, she is right. Shorter than single bond due to presence of double bond character. Longer than double bond due to presence of single bond character.

Cool how they use the hand thingies for each student to get the % on the board like that, wish we would of had that.. would be beneficial if more schools start to use a similar system, allot of benefits from that I can think of off the top of my head.

clear explanation of lewis structures, formal charge, and resonance. it helps to go to mit opencourseware website and print out the .pdf notes that accompany the lecture. you can work through the notes as she is teaching.
